us.title: HYPE price double bottoms as Hyperliquid volume plunges
us.content: The Hyperliquid token dropped to a crucial support level as volume on its perpetual decentralized trading platform slumped. Hyperliquid (HYPE) dropped to a low of $12.10, a notable level since it was its lowest level on March 13.

us.title: Dogecoin is Facing Rising Bearish Threat as It Drops Toward $0.16: Will Buyers Bounce Back?
us.content: Dogecoin has experienced a significant decline in the past few hours, facing a sharp selloff near resistance levels. This drop was triggered by a statement from Elon Musk, the head of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), clarifying that the U.S. government does not intend to adopt the widely-known memecoin, Dogecoin.

us.title: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink Says Bitcoin Can Rival Dollar As Global Reserve Currency
us.content: BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) CEO Larry Fink raised serious concerns about the long-term health of the U.S. economy, warning that unchecked national debt and growing fiscal deficits could undermine the dollar's dominance as the world's reserve currency. What Happened: In his annual letter to shareholders released on Monday, he cautioned that digital assets like Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) may emerge as a viable alternative if the government fails to rein in spending.

us.title: EXCLUSIVE: Could Trump's 'Liberation Day' Reciprocal Tariffs Crash The Stock Market? 48% Say This
us.content: The stock market will likely be increasingly volatile heading into Wednesday, as President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs are set to be announced on April 2, the so-called "Liberation Day.”

us.title: MARA Holdings eyes $2B stock offering to supercharge Bitcoin acquisitions
us.content: MARA Holdings has launched a $2 billion stock offering to fund Bitcoin acquisitions, mirroring MicroStrategy's approach.

us.title: Stocks Sink Again: Day Could End With Historically Bad March
us.content: Stocks slid again Monday on further pessimism on the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs and renewed fears of a related recession, a fitting end to a brutal month and quarter for equities.

us.title: These 16 dividend stocks have ‘high quality yields' if you want to diversify away from the U.S.
us.content: Investors and traders might focus on the reasons behind periods of decline or higher volatility in the stock market. But long-term investors have always needed to weather stock-market storms, regardless of political trends.

us.title: Wells Fargo's Sameer Samana: Tariff price increases should be incremental and diluted
us.content: Sameer Samana, Wells Fargo Investment Institute head of global equities, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss why he expects the market narrative to transition to tax cuts, where he stands on ex-U.S. markets relative to the S&P, and more.

us.title: S&P 500 Snapshot: Down 4.9% Year To Date
us.content: The S&P 500 fell 1.5% from the previous week, marking its fifth weekly loss in the past six weeks. The index is now 9.17% below its record close from February 19th, 2025 and is down 4.90% year to date.

us.title: Citi Trims Cummins Target to $360 Amid Freight Slowdown, But Keeps Bullish Outlook
us.content:
Citi lowered its price target on Cummins (NYSE:CMI) from $430 to $360, maintaining a Buy rating despite near-term headwinds in the commercial vehicle market. As a result, shares fell around 2% intra-day today.

Citi cited a weaker freight environment and recent cuts to North American truck production forecasts from ACT Research as key factors behind the revised estimates. Dealers are reportedly experiencing “order paralysis” among fleet buyers, who are holding back on new purchases amid uncertainty around Trump-era tariffs and potential revisions to EPA 2027 emissions regulations.

While Citi’s updated 2025 estimates for Cummins now fall toward the lower end of the company’s own guidance, the firm believes CMI is better positioned than peers to navigate the cyclical softness. Unlike others in the space, Cummins benefits from broad geographic reach, a diversified product portfolio, and strong pricing stability.

Among Citi’s coverage of the commercial vehicle sector, Cummins stands out as the only stock with a Buy rating, supported by the company’s ability to withstand short-term pressure while maintaining long-term earnings strength.

us.title: Morgan Stanley's Michael Zezas: A variety of tariff scenarios could play out
us.content: Michael Zezas, Morgan Stanley head of U.S. public policy research, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss potential tariffs scenarios that could play out on April 2nd, why he's favoring fixed income over equities regardless of tariff outcomes, and more.

us.title: Recent economic data is 'stagflationary,' economist says after cutting GDP outlook
us.content: Bank of America Securities senior US economist Aditya Bhave joins Morning Brief to explain that although we will likely see a mild version of stagflation, it would not derail the economy. Bhave elaborates further, noting that the Federal Reserve would likely remain hawkish in this scenario.

us.title: Interesting Ripple (XRP) Price Predictions: Watch Out
us.content: XPR's market capitalization has fallen to around $121 billion, thus steering away from crypto's top 3 club.

us.title: Tech stocks tank, S&P 500 slips as Wall Street braces for Trump tariffs
us.content: Broader S&P 500 index lost more than 1% -- falling 60 points to hit lowest level since September -- while the Dow experienced a more modest decline.

us.title: Equities Demand Higher Risk Premium As Uncertainty Spikes
us.content: The US stock market is demanding a higher risk premium to compensate for the spike in uncertainty, a.k.a. prices are falling, which translates to a higher expected return for some forward time horizon.

france.title: Auto tariffs fuel recession fears
france.content: President Trump is enacting tariffs to bring manufacturing and jobs to the US, but there may be a problem with that plan. In the video above, RBC Capital Markets US economist Michael Reid joins Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton to explain what that problem is.

france.title: Bitcoin trader issues 'overbought' warning as BTC price eyes $84K
france.content: Bitcoin (BTC) ticked higher at the March 31 Wall Street open as traders stayed risk-averse on the short-term BTC price outlook. BTC/USD 1-hour chart.

france.title: Chart Of The Day: Q1 2025 Is Ending - Where Do Markets Stand?
france.content: The markets' swoon started in mid-February and continued right up until the quarter's closing days. The MoneyShow Chart of the Day shows the performance of a wide range of ETFs tracking most major indices and asset classes.

france.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Reminds Investors with Losses on their Investment in Neumora Therapeutics, Inc of Class Action Lawsuit and Upcoming Deadlines - NMRA
france.content: NEW YORK , March 31, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Pomerantz LLP announces that a class action lawsuit has been filed against Neumora Therapeutics, Inc. ("Neumora" or the "Company") (NASDAQ: NMRA).  Such investors are advised to contact Danielle Peyton at newaction@pomlaw.com or 646-581-9980, (or 888.4-POMLAW), toll-free, Ext.

france.title: INVESTOR ALERT: Pomerantz Law Firm Announces the Filing of a Class Action Against Quantum Computing Inc. and Certain Officers - QUBT
france.content: NEW YORK , March 31, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Pomerantz LLP announces that a class action lawsuit has been filed against Quantum Computing Inc. ("QCI" or the "Company") (NASDAQ: QUBT) and certain officers.  The class action, filed in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey, and docketed under 25-cv-01457, is on behalf of a class consisting of all persons and entities other than Defendants that purchased or otherwise acquired QCI securities between March 30, 2020 and January 15, 2025, both dates inclusive (the "Class Period"), seeking to recover damages caused by Defendants' violations of the federal securities laws and to pursue remedies under Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 ("Exchange Act") and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder, against the Company and certain of its top officials.

("SoundHound" or the "Company") (NASDAQ: SOUN) and certain officers. The class action, filed in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California, and docketed under 25-cv-02915, is on behalf of a class consisting of all persons and entities other than Defendants that purchased or otherwise acquired SoundHound securities between May 10, 2024 and March 3, 2025, both dates inclusive (the "Class Period"), seeking to recover damages caused by Defendants' violations of the federal securities laws and to pursue remedies under Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the "Exchange Act") and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder, against the Company and certain of its top officials.

france.title: Support for Trump could wane with continued weakness in stock markets: Callanish Capital CEO
france.content: Haig Bathgate, CEO of Callanish Capital, discusses the potential impact of U.S. tariffs on support for President Donald Trump and says the rise in the European defense stock trade is massively overdone.
